Description: Using data analytics to make farming practices more efficient and effective by precisely managing resources like water, fertilizers, and pesticides. Farmers precisely manage resources such water, fertilizers, pesticides using data from various sources, ensuring they applied right amounts at correct times.

Using historical data to forecast future outcomes, helping farmers anticipate and prepare for challenges such as weather changes and pest infestations. Predictive models analyze past data weather patterns, soil conditions, crop yields provide farmers with insights into when plant, irrigate, harvest most profitable crops.

Analyzing production, transportation, and consumer demand data to reduce waste and improve efficiency in the agricultural supply chain. Farmers agribusinesses reduce waste, improve efficiency, ensure that products reach consumers optimally analyzing production, transportation, consumer demand data.

Promoting sustainable farming practices by optimizing resources such as water, energy, and fertilizers through data analysis. Data-driven practices enable farmers resources more efficiently, reducing waste minimizing environmental impact.

Enabling real-time data collection from various sources, including soil sensors, weather stations, and farm machinery, to monitor crop health and automate farming processes. IoT devices revolutionizing agriculture enabling real-time data collection from various sources, including soil sensors, weather stations, farm machinery.

Analyzing complex agricultural datasets to predict crop yields, detect diseases early, and optimize planting schedules. Machine learning AI increasingly being employed analyze complex agricultural datasets, uncovering patterns trends that might invisible human eye.

Ensuring transparency and traceability in the supply chain by recording every transaction and movement of agricultural products on a blockchain. Blockchain technology gaining traction agriculture because it ensure transparency traceability supply chain.

Using data analytics to build climate-resilient farming practices and minimize environmental impact. Farmers adopt strategies that minimize environmental impact while maximizing resilience extreme weather events analyzing climate data, soil health, crop performance.

Using Knowledge Graphs to organize and connect disparate data, integrating information for user-friendly recommendations and applications in forage systems. Knowledge Graphs organize connect disparate data integrating information user-friendly interface recommendations applications.

Utilizing ArcGIS Knowledge platform to visualize regional system resilience under climatic stochasticity using the Forage Data database. This paper aims fill important gap applying ArcGIS Knowledge platform integrate graph spatial analytics identifying resilient forage systems.
A searchable database for accessing agricultural data published by NASS, allowing customization by commodity, location, or time period.
A web-based tool for accessing and downloading table-level data from the Census of Agriculture Volume 1 publication.
Geospatial data and interactive maps providing information on cropland, crop condition, soil moisture, and land use.
Subject-specific reports with data on crops, livestock, and other agricultural statistics, available by date.
Briefings on small grains summary, grain stocks, and hogs and pigs (September 2025).
Monthly forecasts for crop production, including corn, soybeans, and cotton.
Reports on United States cattle inventory.
Surveys on corn and soybean planted acreage.
Annual survey conducted on mushroom production.
Forecasts for winter wheat production.
Surveys of hog and pig producers.
Report on irrigation water management practices.
Report on the typology of family-owned farms in the U.S.
Gathering conservation data to assess trends and improve programs and services.
Seeking feedback from producers about 2025 crops, stocks, inventories, and values.
